intro: Solenostemon cymosus, commonly known as the spikeplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Solenostemon cymosus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
